results.title: The Royal Silver Jubilee Exhibition Train
results.creator_credit: Michael Pearce, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A look at the Jubilee Exhibition train, housing 700 years of British history. Shows many of the exhibits and the stories behind them, and follows the progress of the train throughout Australia. Narrated by Stuart Wagstaff.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Pearce, Peter Johnson and Film Australia

results.title: The Royal river
results.creator_credit: Kenneth J. Fairbairn and Rayant Pictures
results.brief_description: A journey down the River Thames showing many places of interest: Oxford, Henley Regatta, Windsor Castle (including the interior of historic St Georges Chapel) and Runnymede, the Tower of London showing the Crown Jewels and the Ceremony of the Keys.

results.title: The Royal mile, Edinburgh
results.brief_description: The royal mile lies between Edinburgh Castle and the palace of Holyrood House. Looks at the present and the historic past of this famous thoroughfare.

results.title: The Royal Manor
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: A description of the English town of Richmond which is rich in historical and royal association. Shows scenes of Richmond Palace, Wick House and the Star and Garter Home, concluding with scenes of the Royal Botanical Gardens at Kew.

results.title: The Royal Australian Army Nursing Corps
results.creator_credit: Australia. Army. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Deals with training and work of women who choose army nursing as a career. Recruits take six weeks basic training with the Women’s Royal Australian Army Corps at Queenscliff and afterwards complete their course at the School of Army Health at Healesville. Shows living conditions, sports and recreational facilities.

results.title: The Rover
results.creator_credit: David Michôd, Liz Watts, David Linde, Cappi Ireland, Joel Edgerton, Josephine Ford, South Australian Film Corporation, Lava Bear Films, Blue-Tongue Films, Screen NSW, Screen Australia and Porchlight Films
results.brief_description: 10 years after a global economic collapse, a hardened loner pursues the men who stole his car through the lawless wasteland of the Australian outback, aided by the brother of one of the thieves.

constellations_other.name: True blue, true crime
constellations_other.description: Robert Connolly's The Dry is a recent Australian crime blockbuster, but the writer, director and producer's first film (and first crime film) connects to a longstanding tradition of true-blue crime stories from some of our greatest filmmakers.

results.title: The Roundabout
results.brief_description: Explains that traffic can flow in 16 different directions at an ordinary intersection. The roundabout is designed to bring streams of traffic together, mix them and send them on their right way. Conflicting streams of traffic in a roundabout all travel in the same direction, and reduce head-on collisions.
